results.firPara: Any trickle-down effects from the Premier Leagues astonishing revenue streams will be felt in good time both in Spain and across Europe, but for now La Liga is humming along with decent enough deals. Barcelona are very much back in business after their hands were – to an extent – tied last summer and the early running, certainly where Spains big two are concerned, has been theirs. Samuel Umtitis £21m move from Lyon looks particularly good value after his assured performances at centre-back for France during Euro 2016 and joining him will be the left-back Lucas Digne, another Frenchman, who arrives in a £13.9m move from Paris Saint-Germain after a good season on loan with Roma.
results.secPara: How will Real Madrid react? Perhaps by signing Paul Pogba at the end of a saga that may last all summer, but in the meantime the gruel has been a bit thinner. Álvaro Morata was bought back from Juventus for £23m – originally, it seemed, with the plan to offload him straightaway for a profit – and it seems that, for now, the Spain striker has a place in the fold.
results.webTitle: European football transfers: who has done the best business so far?

results.firPara: Dimitri Payet has told West Ham he is 100% staying at the club. The France playmaker enjoyed an outstanding debut season after being signed from Marseille for £10.7m. He scored 12 goals and assisted 13 more, leading to the 29-year-old being named the clubs player of the year.
results.secPara: Payet went on to shine at Euro 2016, scoring three times as France reached the final, where they lost 1-0 to Portugal. That led to speculation he would leave this summer.
results.webTitle: Dimitri Payet insists he is ‘100% staying’ at West Ham

results.secPara: Todays piffle has set the controls for the heart of the sun
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Joshua Kimmich and Leroy Sané to Man City?

results.firPara: Antonio Conte swerved away from any bold promises. The snazzy monikers were for others to pin on him, not for him to offer up, and he did not mention a rival manager by name, other than his friend Claudio Ranieri. When the comparisons to José Mourinho were put to him he merely acknowledged that some coaches have a winning mentality but not everyone has it in them. The implication was both are blessed, though his follow-up, that those who do are, indeed, special, was about as mischievous as it got.
results.secPara: The Italian offered up only realism as he confronted the considerable task he has taken on at Chelsea. He was emotional, even excited, to have this chance yet conceded those who have discounted his team from mounting a title challenge in the campaign to come would be justified on the evidence of last seasons prolonged traumas. The buzzword was work, revisited regularly as the only verb I know. Im a worker, he said. I like to work, and I know only this road for the club to compete, to return to the Champions League, to get back to winning the title. It said everything that he had crammed his first public engagement in his new role between gruelling double training sessions at Cobham.
results.webTitle: Antonio Conte insists Chelsea face hard road back to the top

results.firPara: Aitor Karankas Riverside revolution continues apace with Middlesbrough close to making their sixth summer signing in Antonio Barragán, the Valencia full-back who will cost £3m.
results.secPara: Barragán has agreed personal terms and his Valencia team-mate Álvaro Negredo is also on the point of joining him at the promoted Premier League club on a year-long loan with a view to the striker completing a £9m transfer next summer.
results.webTitle: Middlesbrough close to sixth summer signing of Valencia’s Antonio Barragán

results.firPara: • 20-year-old signs four-year contract with south coast club
results.secPara: Bournemouth have signed the Liverpool winger Jordon Ibe for a club-record transfer fee, understood to be £15 million. The 20-year-old has agreed a four-year contract with the Premier League club, whose previous record transfer outlay was for the striker Benik Afobe in January.
results.webTitle: Bournemouth sign Liverpool winger Jordon Ibe for club record £15m

results.firPara: Gianni Infantino is set to be interviewed by a member of Fifas ethics committee amid allegations that the president breached world footballs governing bodys code of ethics.
results.secPara: Infantino, who strongly denies the allegations, will be spoken to as part of a preliminary investigation. If it is decided that a formal inquiry should be opened, Infantino could be suspended for 90 days.
results.webTitle: Fifa president Gianni Infantino set for interview over alleged ethics breaches

results.firPara: In a scene vaguely reminiscent of a subpar romcom in which our heroine turns up to a party in the same outfit as her nemesis, Barcelona and Real Madrid both unveiled purple away kits for the upcoming season on Thursday.
results.secPara: The clash of colors adds fuel to the fire between the bitter rivals as well as their respective sponsors, Nike and Adidas.
results.webTitle: Real Madrid and Barcelona release purple away kits on same day
